main.bio: A high school student who loves to code and work with others to develop amazing things! In my free time I love to go hiking and watch sports!

resume.skillmessage: Here's a quick list of things I love to work with!

education.description: Describe your experience at school, what you learned, what useful skills you have acquired etc.

work.title: Software Intern
work.description: Worked on creating a mobile app, while currently working on improving frontend and backend features of the website along with UX/UI team, marketing, and sounds designer.

work.title: Software Developer
work.description: Worked on an app to compliment the website for car show ticketing. Also, built a mobile app (Built with React Native) and backend (Built with Node.js) that shows crowded areas as restrictions start to ease due to COVID-19.

work.company: FRC Robotics (Popcorn Penguins Team 6238) and (Lynbrook Robotics Team 846)
work.title: Secretary and Software Member
work.description: Worked on writing teleoperated code for the robot, the live dashboard for the robot and vision system for our robot. In addition, I have presented to the community on robotics topics. As Secretary I am in charge of administrative tasks.

projects.title: Shapezoid
projects.category: A game built with Apple's Spritekit and Swift using textures,trajectories/paths, and more.

projects.title: ChatPlane
projects.category: An end to end encryption messaging app created using Swift and RNCryptor and Crypto Swift. This also supports voice and video callingover https

projects.title: RouteSafe
projects.category: Worked with Beroundup to create an app providing info on crowded areas to help small businesses during COVID-19. I created the backend as well as the frontend to find areas that are busy and can accommodate more people under social distancing guidelines. Utilized MapBox's API, Google Data, MIT's COVID Safe Paths and adds aggregates user data. It includes built in privacy features such as location blacklisting.

projects.title: REAP
projects.category: Residential Electricity Analyzer and Predictor. Synopsys Science Fair project using R and Python to predict residential electricity prices. The model selects the 25 most influential factors from 100 factors provided by the US Energy Department using a random forest classifier, then applies them by importance.

projects.title: Boxed
projects.category: A MacOS app using shortcuts to easily move windows, similar to the popular app Magnet.

projects.title: Github Contributions Menu Bar
projects.category: A MacOS menu bar app to display your GitHub Contributions.

projects.title: Night Shift Menu Bar
projects.category: A MacOS menu bar app built to easily access Night Shift.
